Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Cesar Rivera, for defendant, Ruben Cerezo-Hernandez and PTO, Evelyn Jimenez. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Arraignment & Bail Hearing as to Janny Lopez-Calo (40) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 5/26/2010. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all counts of the Indictment. The case is to be referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel states that the pretrial report recommends bail and requests that $5,000.00 unsecured be posted. Defense counsel also states that defendant will not be residing at any of the places mention in the indictment. Counsel for the Government objects and a proffer is given to the Court. Arguments by counsel are heard. The Court after hearing arguments of counsel sets bail in the amt. of $10,000.00 cash or secured. Defendant shall participate in an inpatient/outpatient program as deemed necessary by PTO. Defendant shall not reside in any of the areas mention in the indictment. Standard conditions of release shall be fully applicable. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:31.Hearing ended at 01:41. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Arraignment as to John Doe #3, True Name Julius Julio Cintron (39) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 7/19/2010. Defendant waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez for trial scheduling. Detention Hearing as to John Doe #3 True Name Julius Julio Cintron held on 7/19/2010. Defense counsel notes that there's a bail recommendation within the PTS Report, however, the defendant won't pursue bail at this moment. Reserves right to re- open. Government's proffer heard and requests detention. Defense objects the government's proffer. Court notes there are contradictory proffers, however, the Court understands that the presumption of flight risk hasn't been rebutted, therefore, the  defendant is to remain under custody pending trial. Order to issue. Defense may move to re-open the bail issue, if deemed so necessary. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Felix Toledo (not used, the defendant was fluent in the English Language) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 3:21 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:38 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Jose Capo and defense counsel Victor Miranda. USPO Patricia Encarnacion also present. (Entered: 07/20/2010)

Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all cts. The case is to be referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial setting. Defendant's father shall be qualified by PTO as 3rd. party custodian. Defendant has to seek or maintain employment. Defendant shall not reside or work in any of the areas mentioned in the Indictment. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Motion Hearing as to Emanuel Arce-Gonzalez held on 10/27/2010 re 420 MOTION (Wood- Quintero Inquiry) re 419 INFORMATIVE motion new counsel, 418 Notice of Attorney Appearance - Defendant filed by USA. AUSAs-Jose Capo & Alberto Lopez and attorney Victor Ramos were present. Deft was present in court. The Court advised counsel that the defendant's Financial Affidavit (Dkt#14) reflects that defendant has no money to pay for counsel and Mr. Ramos is retained. Hence, defendant either lied to the Magistrate-Judge under oath and he may be charged with additional penalities or someone else is paying for Mr. Ramos' fees. The Court is concerned that a co-defendant may be paying for Mr Arce's legal representation, and if so, defendant should be advised of a possible conflict of interest. Defense attorney informed that defendant's mother was paying his attorney's fees and that he could produce the contract she signed. If a contract exists, AUSA-Capo requested the Court to inquire as to the source of the mnoney to pay for her son's legal representation. The Court instructed attorney Ramos to produce the contract in chambers tomorrow before noon. Parties will meet in chambers and the Court and the government will review it; if further information is required, the hearing will be reopened. (Court Reporter Joyce Del Valle.)(Court Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. )Hearing set for 03:00.Hearing held at 03:50.Hearing ended at 04:15. (ja) (Entered: 10/28/2010)

Minute for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Bond Revocation Hearing as to Jonathan Santiago held on 1/25/2011. Present: SAUSA A. Lopez & Atty. Rivera Esteves. Dft is UC. Gvt leaves the issue at the discretion of the Ct. Defense states that dft's common law wife and stepmother are present in court and that the stepmother is willing to serve as a 3rd party custodian. USPO Desiree Reyes informs that the investigation has not concluded but it seems that she will be approved as TPC. After hrg. the parties, the Ct decides not to revoke the bail. Conditions modified to reflect that the stepmother will figure as the 3rd party custodian instead of the dft's grandmother. Dft is forewarned re: further violations. Dft is to be released.(Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:36.Hearing ended at 09:40. (ct) (Entered: 01/25/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Erick Lopez-Calo (46) Count 1,2,3,4,5,6 held on 3/11/2011. Present were SAUSA Cesar Rivera, Ms. Rachel Brill, PTO E. Jimenez. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. Case is referred to Judge Perez-Gimenez for trial scheduling. As to bail, the Government didn't oppose the recommendation made by Pretrial. Bail was set in the amount of $5,000.00 cash or secured, UA and/or treatment, curfew without EM, employment, plus all other standard conditions of release. Defendant is to reside with his mother and is not to enter or approach any of the areas mentioned in the indictment. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Status Conference as to Carlos Pizarro-Morales, Angel Betancourt-Perez, Jose Hiram Ramos- de-Jesus, Jayson Rodriguez-Santos held on 5/23/2011.AUSA-Alberto Lopez and attorneys Lydia Lizarribar, Francisco Dolz and Javier Morales were present; attys Hector Deliz and Irma Valdejuli were absent. Jury trial scheduled for today was reset for August 1, 2011. Defendant Angel Betancourt was recently arrested and is scheduled for arraignment on May 25th. AUSA-Lopez informed that all discovery was provided and the government is ready for trial. Attorney Lizarribar informed that she met with her client again last night and he will be going to trial; counsel informed she will be on vacation from June 30th through August Ist. Defendant-Jose Hiram Ramos- filed a suppression motion which is pending before the Court. Counsel for defendant Victor Lopez informed that although his client had filed a Change of Plea motion now he is undecided. Attorney Dolz and his client will be meeting with the government to go over the evidence in this case. The government stated that plea offers were withdrawn except as to Jayson Rodriguez, and defendants Carlos Pizarro and Angel Betancourt which the government will contact and give a final plea offer deadline. Jury Trial set for 8/1/2011 at 10:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez. (Court Reporter Vickie Eastvold.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:30.Hearing ended at 11:15.Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (ja) (Entered: 05/24/2011)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez:Case called for Change of Plea Hearing as to Victor Lopez-Ortiz on 6/21/2011, but same was NOT held. AUSA-Olga Castellon and attorney Javier Morales were present. Defendant was also present. Defense counsel informed that today the prosecutor talked directly to the defendant regarding the evidence against him and the terms of the plea agreement. Nevertheless, defendant rejected the plea offer. Defense counsel informed that he advised his client of the risks of going to trial. In light of this situation, the government withdrew its plea offer and requested a trial date. Case will be scheduled for trial. Defendant was advised that if he wanted to enter a plea, it would have to be a straight plea. Motions terminated as to Victor Lopez-Ortiz: 1172 MOTION for change of plea filed by Victor Lopez-Ortiz, 1231 Second MOTION for change of plea and Notice of Availability filed by Victor Lopez-Ortiz, 1254 INFORMATIVE Motion regarding Absence filed by Victor Lopez-Ortiz. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M Perez-Gimenez: Status/Scheduling Conference as to Angel Betancourt-Perez held on 8/2/2012. Present: AUSA Dina Avila and defense counsel Jose Olmo. Defense informs that plea negotiations are still ongoing. If a plea agreement is not reached disposing all three cases (CR. 10-0175, CR. 11-0181 and CR. 11-0367), the defendant will then ponder entering a straight plea. Defendant is inclined to enter a plea of guilty and not go to trial. Requests 21 days to file motion for the Court to consider all three cases as part of the same conspiracy. The Court Grants the request. Government informs that discovery has been provided and will file an opposition to the motion. Sidebar Conference held. Depending on the Court's ruling a Further Status Conference will be set. Hearing set for 11:00 a.m. Hearing held at 11:00 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:15 a.m. (sr) (Entered: 08/06/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jonathan Buster-Torres (47) held on 8/11/2016. Present were AUSA Dina Avila, and AFPD Vivian I. Torralba. The defendant was present in court, under supervised release conditions, and was assisted by official certified court interpreter. The Court after having heard both parties, made a finding that the defendant violated the conditions of his supervised release term by not reporting having been arrested in a timely manner, as cited on the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer on May 14, 2016. Due to defendant's positive adjustment, the Court did not revoke his term of supervised release. A stern warning was given, and any future violations of his conditions may result in the revocation of his supervised release term. Finally, the defendant shall continue under the same terms and conditions as previously imposed. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 11:30.Hearing held at 11:37.Hearing ended at 11:48.Interpreter Marie Hernandez. USPO Yvette Villegas (om) (Entered: 08/16/2016)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez:Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Victor Roman-Rivera (13) held on 1/17/2017. Present were AUSA Marc S. Chattah, and retained counsel Miguel E. Miranda- Gutierrez. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals, and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office, except the drug violation committed in the state of New Jersey. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed as stated at the motion filed at docket no. 2419 as to the matter that defendant left the jurisdiction without permission. Hence, supervised  release previously imposed on March 25, 2011 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to Nine (9) months of imprisonment. Upon release from custody, the defendant was placed under supervised release term of Six (6) years under the same supervised conditions previously imposed as stated at the judgment filed at docket no. 1034. Reconsideration requested was denied. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:57.Hearing ended at 11:08.Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Daniel R. Dominguez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Freddie Villegas-Cirino (63) held on 3/21/2018. Present were AUSA Nicolas Warren Cannon, and AFPD Edwin A. Mora-Rolland. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals and was assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations filed by the U.S. Probation Office at docket no. 2488 , and requested that conditions of supervised release be modified or in the alternative be sentenced to time served and upon release be provided with outpatient treatment. The United States had no objections, that part of the conditions be included that defendant be provided outpatient treatment with a curfew and electronic monitoring device. No objection by the defense. The Court after having heard the parties, made a ruling that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release as stated at the motions filed at docket 2488 , and hence Supervised release term imposed on May 17, 2011 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to Time Served with a Supervised Release term of twenty-four (24) months. As part of the Supervised Release terms, upon release from confinement, the defendant was placed on Home Confinement with curfew from 6:00 p.m. to 6:00 a.m. and shall wear an Electronic Monitoring Device. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. The defendant was strongly forewarned that any other violation to the terms of supervised release, the Court may impose a statutory term of imprisonment. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 03:24.Hearing ended at 04:10.Interpreter Mayra Cardona. USPO Guillermo Arbona. (om) (Entered: 03/21/2018)

JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Freddie Villegas-Cirino (63). Impr of time served. SRT of 24 months. Home confinement for 6 months with curfew and EMD. Signed by Judge Daniel R. Dominguez on 3/21/2018.(om) (Entered: 03/21/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Hearing on Revocation of Supervised Release as to Victor Lopez-Ortiz held on August 16, 2018. Present were AUSA Cesar S. Rivera-Giraud, and AFPD Jessica Earl. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshals and assisted by certified court interpreter. The defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as stated at the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Office at docket no. 2528 . Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. The defense requested a term of 12 months and 1 day without further supervised release to follow. The United States requested a guideline imprisonment range from 3 to 9 months with further supervised release term. The Court after having heard the parties, made a ruling that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release as stated at the motions filed at docket 2558 , and hence Supervised release term imposed on September 30, 2015 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to 14 months of imprisonment with a supervised release term of 18 months. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. The defense requested reconsideration. Reconsideration was denied. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 11:19.Hearing ended at 11:39 Interpreter Ani Navarro. USPO Guillermo Arbona. (om) (Entered: 08/17/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jesus M. Torres-Coss (56) held on June 7, 2019. Present AUSA Corinne Cordero-Romo, and court appointed counsel Marie L. Cortes-Cortes. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshal, and assisted by certified court interpreter Virginia Santamaria. Counsel for the defendant requested continuance of the revocation hearing. This defendant has two (2) pending cases, Cr. 17-621 DRD, AND 17-531 GAG and counsel is in the process of plea negotiations with the United States to disposed both cases. The Court after hearing arguments, denied the continuance requested. Short side bar held. Then, the defendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as filed by the U.S. Probation Office ECF No. 2562 . After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed as stated at the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Officer at ECF No. 2562 . Hence, supervised release previously imposed on October 11, 2011 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to Time Served, with a Supervised Release term of 6 years. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.)Hearing set for 11:15.Hearing held at 12:08.Hearing ended at 01:06.Interpreter Virginia Santamaria. USPO Joseline Perez (om) (Entered: 06/12/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Anthony Munoz-Flores (30) held on 9/5/2019. Present: AUSA Enrique Silva, AFPD Victor Chico, USPO Alejandra Nazario. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The parties informed that the Government is moving to dismiss the allegation relating to the domestic violence offense as the case was dismissed in state court. Counsel for defendant also informed that they are waiving the hearing as to all the other allegations. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing was filed. The Court approved the same and made a finding of probable cause as to the allegations contained in the motions filed at Docket Nos. 2661 and 2668 with the exception of the alleged domestic violence violation. Case is referred to Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez for setting of Final Revocation Hearing. Defendant will remain detained pursuant to the order entered by the presiding judge at Docket No. 2662. 2694 MOTION for Disclosure was granted. Minute Entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Miguel Castro-Muriel (38) held on September 17, 2019. Present AUSA Enrique Silva-Aviles, and AFPD Victor P. Miranda-Corrada. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshal, and assisted by certified interpreter Carlos Rabello. At the outset the defendant decided to contest the supervised release violations as alledged in the motion filed by the U.S. Probation Office. Then, it was clarified that the defendant will be contested the matter of the incident on Septemer 22, 2018. The Court made a ruling that matter as stated at the motion will be not taken into consideration, including violation included at item no. 4, violation of special condition. The dendant waived the hearing, and accepted the allegations as to Standard Condition No. 1, 3 and 7 as filed by the U.S. Probation Office ECF No. 2669 . Violation of Special Condition was not considered. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. The Unites placed its position for the record. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release, hence, supervised release previously imposed on October 15, 2015 was revoked. The defendant was sentenced to Seven (7) months of imprisonment with a supervised release to be served until May 2nd, 2022. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Rachelle M. Robinson-Ware.)Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 11:38.Hearing ended at 12:07 Interpreter Carlos Rabello. Task Force USPO Luz M. Acevedo. (om) (Entered: 09/17/2019)

After the parties conferring off the record, AFPD Santos informed that since docket 2777 had been granted in part and denied in part, they had filed motion 2798 requesting documents pertaining to defendant's stay in Guarabi, which are needed in order to decide whether the preliminary hearing would be waived or seen; therefore a short continuance was being requested in order to obtain those documents. The Government agreed with the continuance, and the Court granted the same. Preliminary Revocation Hearing reset for 3/3/2020 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Mariano Bermudez-Maysonet (68) held on 2/24/2020. Present: AUSA Enrique Silva, AFPD Victor Miranda, USPO Ivelisse Alonso. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by the certified court interpreter. Counsel for defendant informed that they are waiving the hearing. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing was filed. The Court approved the same and made a finding of probable cause as to the allegations contained in the motion filed at Docket No. 2758 . Case is referred to Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez for setting of Final Revocation Hearing. As to detention, the government, defense counsel and USPO jointly requested for the defendant to be released on conditions and that he ultimately be placed in an inpatient drug treatment program. That is also the recommendation of the Court. However, the defendant will remain detained pursuant to the order entered at Docket No. 2759. Defense counsel informed that a motion will be filed before the presiding judge. (Court Reporter DCR/ Courtroom 9.) Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 10:23. Hearing ended at 10:27. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Victor Lopez-Ortiz (66) held on 3/5/2020. Present were AUSA Enrique Silva, AFPD Ivan Santos and USPO Jose Lozada. Defendant was present under custody, present in court and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed and approved. Probable cause found as to the allegations contained in docket 2768 , and the case was referred to Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez for the full revocation hearing. Defendant will remain under custody. Defense counsel informed that the defendant's religious beliefs are based on Rastafarianism and requested for his is hair to remain uncut. Also informed that he does not eat red meat according to his beliefs. After having heard the parties at sidebar, the Court recommends that the defendant be transferred to MDC-Guaynabo in order to accommodate defendant's request. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 11.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 02:17. Hearing ended at 02:25. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (ram) (Entered: 03/05/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Mariano Bermudez-Maysonet

held on March 6, 2020. Present AUSA Enrique Silva-Aviles, and AFPD Victor P. Miranda-Corrada. The defendant was present in court, under the custody of the U.S. Marshal, and assisted by certified court interpreter Virginia Santamaria. The dendant waived the hearing, and accepted the violation of the conditions of supervised release while being under supervised release as stated by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF No. 2758 . Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide relevant mitigating circumstances to be considered by the Court. The United States, in light that this case a mandatory revocation is applicable, requested the imposition of a term at the lower end of the guideline with in or out patient drug treatment. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed. The defendant was sentenced to be imprisoned for a term of 11 months followed by a term of supervised release of 3 years under the same conditions as originally imposed. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Rachelle M. Robinson-Ware.)Hearing set for 10:30.Hearing held at 11:01.Hearing ended at 11:15.Interpreter Virginia Santamaria. USPO Ivelisse Alonso. (om) (Entered: 03/09/2020)

Due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic and pursuant to the Order entered by Chief Judge Gelpi under the CARES Act (Docket 13, 20-mc-0088), the Court finds that pending hearing as to this defendant cannot be conducted in person in this district without seriously jeopardizing public health and safety, and that this case cannot be further delayed without serious harm to the interest of justice. Hearing on revocation of supervised release will be held via Videoconferencing ("VTC"). During this VTC all participants will connect remotely. Further instructions on how to access, Id and password will follow by email. By no later than May 22, 2020 defendant shall file an informative motion indicating if he consents to have this proceeding via VTC. Lopez- Ortiz (66) held on June 29, 2020. Present: AUSA Jeanette M. Collazo-Ortiz, and AFPD Ivan Santos-Castaldo. The record should reflect that this revocation hearing is based in the decision of the USCA, judgment filed at ECF. No. 2739, and the Mandate filed at ECF No. 2743 related to the motion notifying violations of supervised release filed by the U.S. Probation Office on May 2, 2018 at ECF No. 2528. In addition the record should reflect that the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant has consented to proceed by VTC, and defendant has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record filed at ECF No. 2855. The Court certified interpreter Felix Toledo was acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line, as well, at MDC-Guaynabo and the Court had a clear view of him on screen. Both parties requested a term of time served. Allocution heard. Supervised Release term previously imposed on September 30, 2015 was revoked. Imprisonmet of TIME SERVED until July 5, 2019. Supervised Release term of 18 months. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz (VTC). Interpreter Felix Toledo (VTC). Minute Entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Juan M. Perez-Gimenez: Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Victor M. Lopez-Ortiz (66) held on June 29, 2020 in RE Motion informing violations of Supervised Release filed by U.S. Probation on January 22, 2020, ECF No. 2768. Present: AUSA Jeanette M. Collazo- Ortiz, and AFPD Ivan Santos-Castaldo. The record should reflect that the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. Therefore, the defendant has consented to proceed by VTC, and defendant has secured a waiver to that effect that appears on the record filed at ECF No. 2855. The Court certified interpreter Felix Toledo was acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line, as well, at MDC-Guaynabo and the Court had a clear view of him on screen. Both parties requested a term of time served. The Court made a finding that the defendant violated the conditions of supervised release by not complying with the inpatient treatment center, using controlled substances while on supervision, and unlawful possession of controlled substances as stated by the US Probation Officer at ECF No. 2768. Prior of imposing sentencing, the Court made several findings on why term of imprisonment was imposed. The defendant was sentenced to a term of 9 months with no further supervised release to follow. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. (Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz (VTC).)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 04:18.Hearing ended at 04:30.Interpreter Felix Toledo (VTC).USPO Jose Lozada (VTC) (om) (Entered: 07/01/2020)

ORDER as to Janny Lopez-Calo. Defendant is pending initial appearance for the alleged supervised release violations informed by the USPO in Docket No. 2853. The Federal Public Defender is appointed to represent Defendant for the revocation proceedings. Defendant is not entitled to a preliminary revocation hearing as he is under conditions of  release (see F.R.Cr.P. 32.1(b)(1)(A)). Defense counsel is encouraged to arrange a client interview by telephone to consider waiving the initial appearance and get the waiver signed by Defendant to avoid a VTC. The waiver of the initial appearance shall be filed by 9/2/2020 and shall state that, pursuant to FRCP 32.1, Defendant was advised of the right to be present during an initial appearance on revocation proceedings; to have a Magistrate Judge inform him of the alleged violations of supervised release; his right to retain counsel or to request that counsel be appointed; his right to a revocation hearing before the District Judge; and upon the advice of counsel Defendant waives the initial appearance. If the waiver is filed in compliance with the above, the same will be approved and the matter will be referred to the attention of presiding District Judge for a final revocation hearing. In the meantime, Defendant shall continue abiding by all the conditions of his supervised release term. If the waiver is not filed, the Initial Appearance will be promptly set via VTC. Signed by US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive on 08/19/2020. (cvr) (Entered: 08/19/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Pablo Beltran-Rodriguez (20) held on 1/29/2021 via VTC. Present was AFPD Carmen Coral Rodriguez. Defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed via VTC. Defendant was advised of the SRT violations as alleged in the motion filed at Docket No. 2845 and as to his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether the supervised release conditions had been violated. Upon the defendant's request, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. Defendant will be represented by the FPD's Office. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant[s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant(s] or  tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 2/12/2021 at 10:00 AM in VTC Bridge BJM before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin. Defendant is ordered temporarily detained. The USMS is ordered to file an informative motion, by not later than a week from today, informing the Court why the defendant was not brought to Court before today. (Court Reporter Robin Dispenzieri.) Hearing held at 02:52. Hearing ended at 02:57. Interpreter Janis Palma. (rom) (Entered: 01/29/2021)

***PTLED IN ERROR - Wrong Defendant.*** Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Richard Morales-Cruz (18) held on 2/12/2021 via VTC. Present were AUSA Maria Montanez, AFPD Victor Miranda and USPO Damary Flores. Defendant was present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed by way of VTC. Government informed that they will not be moving forward as to the possession of a firearm allegation. Defense counsel informed that the defendant is not contesting the remaining allegations. The Court found probable cause as to the allegations contained in the motion filed at Docket No. 2845 , with the exception of the allegation regarding possession of a firearm. Matter is referred to Judge Pedro A. Delgado-Hernandez for setting of a final revocation hearing. The parties are jointly requesting an expedited setting as they anticipate jointly moving forward with a sentence recommendation of time served. As to detention, defense counsel argued for release proffering stricter conditions. Government moved for detention. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered the defendant release under the same SRT conditions with the added condition of home detention with EM. The defendant shall reside in Puerto Rico with his aunt. (Court Reporter DCR/ ZoomGov Recording.) Hearing set for 01:30. Hearing held at 01:40. Hearing ended at 01:55. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (bgl) Modified on 2/12/2021 (mem). (Entered: 02/12/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez:Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Roberto Santana-Rivera (31) held on 3/9/2021. Present: AUSA Daniel Olinghouse (for Jenifer Hernandez) and AFPD Victor Chico. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Motion filed by USPO Reyes at Docket No. 2943 . The defendant was also advised of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States' case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the reversal of any conviction, the exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 3/19/2021 10:00 AM in VTC Bridge MEL before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. The Government is reminded that an interpreter must be provided if any of its witnesses cannot testify in the English Language.(Court Reporter DCR.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 03:20.Hearing ended at 03:26.Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Pedro A. Delgado-Hernandez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Pablo Beltran-Rodriguez (20) held on 3/10/2021. Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, AFPD Victor Miranda, and USPOs Damary Flores and Elsie Rivera. The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. The defendant consented to proceed by VTC, and he secured waiver to that effect that appears on the record. The interpreter assisted the defendant via telephone at FPD's Office and we had a clear view of him on screen. Defense counsel stated there are no contested facts in this case, that the defendant has accepted responsibility as to the grade c violations, and requested that defendant be sentenced to time already served with no supervision to follow. The Government concurred with defense counsel's request for time served as to imprisonment term, but differed in counsel's request for no supervision to follow. Further, it stated that defendant's non-compliance with supervision terms warrants that, in the present revocation, an additional term be imposed. Allocution heard. The Court found that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release, and  supervised release term was REVOKED. Defendant was sentenced to TIME SERVED, followed by an additional supervised release term of eighteen (18) months, under the same conditions originally imposed. (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.)Hearing set for 10:00.Hearing held at 10:09.Hearing ended at 10:30.Interpreter Ani Navarro. (vso) (Entered: 03/10/2021)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Pablo Beltran-Rodriguez (20), IMPR: TIME SERVED; SRT: Eighteen (18) months. Signed by Judge Pedro A. Delgado-Hernandez on 3/10/2021. (vso) (Entered: 03/10/2021)

Minute entry for proceedings held before U.S. District Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Roberto Santana-Rivera (31) held on April 8, 2021. Present via VTC AUSA Jenifer Yois Hernandez-Vega, and AFPD Victor J. Gonzalez-Bothwell. USPO Desiree Reyes also present. The defendant was under custody at MDC-Guaynabo and was assisted by certified interpreter Felix Toledo. All parties connected remotely. The record should reflect the proceedings are being held by VTC, given the emergency situation created by the COVID-19 pandemic. The defendant waived his right to be physically present for the revocation hearing and consented to proceed by VTC. The Court made a finding pursuant to the CARES ACT that defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived his right to be physically present for the revocation hearing, since he has consented to proceed by videoconference after consultation with counsel of record. Certified Court interpreter Felix Toledo was acting and assisting the defendant on a secured line at MDC-Guaynabo and the Court had a clear view of him on screen. The defendant waived the hearing and accepted the violations of the conditions of supervised release as stated by the U.S. Probation Office at ECF No. 2943. Counsel for the defendant proceeded to provide several mitigations factors to be considered by the Court, and requested the defendant be sentenced to time served and be transferred to a Halfway House. The United States requested a term of 10 months and additional Supervised Release term. Defendant refused to allocute. After hearing the parties, the Court made a finding that the defendant has violated the conditions of supervised release previously imposed on by using controlled substances, failing to comply with the instructions of the probation officer as indicated in the motion filed by the Probation Officer at ECF No. 2943. Accordingly, the supervised release term imposed on July 18, 2011 was revoked. Imprisonment for a term of 6 months. Supervised release term of 24 months under the same conditions originally imposed on him on July 18, 2011 with several additional conditions added. In addition, the defendant shall participate in a residential reentry center (halfway house) for a period of 12 months. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment of revocation form. The defendant was advised as to his right to appeal, etc. Counsel for the defendant objected the term imposed by the Court. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:03.Hearing ended at 09:20. Interpreter Felix Toledo. USPO Desiree Reyes-Calderon. (om) (Entered: 04/08/2021)
JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Roberto Santana-Rivera (31). IMPR OF 6 MONTHS. SRT of 24 months. Halfway house of 12 months. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 4/8/2021.(om) (Entered: 04/09/2021)

ORDER denying 3001 Motion Requesting Sentencing Transcript as to Ruben Rodriguez-Adorno (36). Pursuant to Misc. No. 20-061 (GAG) In Re: Transcript Requests in Criminal Cases. SECOND Amended General Standing Order. Read as follow: "Court Reporters will not receive, nor process transcript requests made by a defendants counsel of record or pro se litigants. Except for the United States, all transcript requests shall be filed by motion with the Court and will be processed when so ordered by the presiding judge. Unless otherwise authorized by order of the presiding judge, transcripts shall remain under the sole custody of counsel of record, who shall not provide a copy of the same to the defendant or any third party."Signed by Judge Jay A.
